DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine 4 month resistance exercise program reduce knee osteoarthritis pain functional impairment cartilage turnover .
DOC.brief_title: Resistance Exercise Knee Osteoarthritis Pain , Functional Impairment Cartilage Turnover
DOC.criteria: Osteoarthritis ( OA ) knee > 6 month moderate severe pain immediately follow 50foot walk knee pain primarily due tibiofemoral OA patellofemoral OA bilateral stand anteriorposterior radiograph demonstrate grade 2 3 OA target knee willing able participate regular exercise four month free musculoskeletal limitation would preclude resistance exercise participation free abnormal cardiovascular response screen grade maximal walk test unable walk regular resistance exercise training ( > 3X week ) within past 6 month specific low back pain acute back injury spinal stenosis precludes walk one block due neurogenic claudication major injury either knee within prior 12 month surgery either knee within last 12 month lumbar radiculopathy vascular claudication significant anterior knee pain due diagnose isolated patellafemoral syndrome chondromalacia either knee corticosteroid viscosupplement injection within three month study participation add new counter prescription pain medication within two month study participation
